column4: I found network manager to be a PITA, I had to keep to icons on the panel, when one wouldn't dial, I'd use the other one. Kppp works out of the box.

That's the nice thing about Linux - options. To each his or her own. Personally, I love network-manager, though I find the fact that one needs to comment out everything in /etc/network/interfaces to be a pain.
Once I had it set up though, I think it is the best thing for the job for me.
